channel.title: Team on EICP-LAB
channel.description: Recent content in Team on EICP-LAB

item.title: Chenglin Li
item.description:
PhD student

Email：chenglin.li@connect.hkust-gz.edu.cn

Chenglin Li is a PhD student in the Innovation, Policy, and Entrepreneurship (IPE) Thrust at HKUST(GZ). He holds a Master’s degree of Management Science in Public Administration from Sun Yat-sen University and a Bachelor’s degree of Management in Public Administration from Lanzhou University. His research explores the effectiveness and social impacts of energy and climate policies using quantitative methodologies. Currently, he is focusing on China’s low-carbon energy transition through the lens of just transition.

item.title: Jiao Xiong
item.description:
PhD student

Email: jxiong481@connect.hkust-gz.edu.cn

Jiao Xiong is a second-year PhD student in the Innovation, Policy, and Entrepreneurship (IPE) and the Carbon Neutrality and Climate Change (CNCC) Thrust at The Hong Kong University of Science and Technology (Guangzhou). She holds a Master’s degree in Economic Geography from the Institute of Geographic Sciences and Natural Resources Research at the Chinese Academy of Sciences, and completed her Bachelor’s degree in Economics at the Central University of Finance and Economics. Jiao’s research focuses on the transition of fossil fuel infrastructure, with a particular emphasis on offshore wind technology and clean energy finance and policy. Her work has been published in leading journals, such as Energy Policy and Energy. Recent publications include studies on the geographic distribution and economic impacts of photovoltaic poverty alleviation in China, the competitive evolution of photovoltaic power generation, and China’s cross-border energy relationships within the “Belt and Road” framework.

item.title: Qing Huang
item.description:
Research Assistant

Email：huangqing1@ucass.edu.cn

Qing Huang is a research assistant in the Energy Infrastructure and Climate Policy Lab. She is currently pursuing a Master’s degree in Economics at the University of Chinese Academy of Social Sciences and holds a Bachelor’s degree in Management from Guangdong University of Foreign Studies. Her research interests include innovation and entrepreneurship, the Chinese economy, environmental economics, and applied microeconomics. Her work has been published in journals such as Land Use Policy and Science Research Management. Currently, she is engaged in the area about the impacts of environmental regulation, foreign technology restrictions and generative AI.

item.title: Siyuan Fan
item.description:
Mphil student

Email：sfan784@connect.hkust-gz.edu.cn

Siyuan FAN is a second-year MPhil student in Innovation, Policy, and Entrepreneurship Thrust at The Hong Kong University of Science and Technology (Guangzhou). She holds a Master of Science degree in Business Analysis from The Chinese University of Hong Kong and a Bachelor’s degree in Financial Management (Financial Engineering) from Hunan University. Her current research focuses on climate change and urban resilience, employing a combination of econometrics and AI methodologies, including the use of large language models and other advanced techniques.

item.title: Yafei Xu
item.description:
Research Assistant

Email：15533505392@163.com

Yafei Xu is a research assistant in the Energy Infrastructure and Climate Policy Lab. She got the Master’s degree in management at Lanzhou University and the Bachelor’s degree in Management from Northeastern University. Her research interests include environmental economics. Her work has been published in journals such as Science of the Total Environment and Journal of Hazardous Materials. Currently, she is engaged in the area about the energy transition and energy economics.

item.title: Yangsiyu Lu
item.description:
Group Lead

Email: yangsiyulu@hkust-gz.edu.cn

Dr. Yangsiyu Lu is an assistant professor at the Carbon Neutrality and Climate Change Thrust and the Innovation, Policy, and Entrepreneurship Thrust. She holds a Ph.D. in Environmental Economics from the University of Oxford, a M.E. in Energy and Environment from IMT Mines Albi (France), and a M.E. and a B.E. in Environmental Science and Engineering from Shanghai Jiao Tong University. Before joining HKUST(GZ), she worked as a research fellow at the Paris School of Economics and Boston University.

item.title: Zhenhuan Yang
item.description:
PhD student

Zhenhuan Yang is a second-year PhD student at The Hong Kong University of Science and Technology (Guangzhou), where he specializes in the Innovation, Policy, and Entrepreneurship Thrust (IPE) and the Carbon Neutrality and Climate Change Thrust (CNCC). He holds a Master’s degree in Statistics from Hunan University and a Bachelor’s degree in Applied Statistics from Anhui Agricultural University. Prior to joining the COOL team, Zhenhuan served as a research assistant at the School of Management, University of Science and Technology of China (USTC). His research primarily focuses on the causal relationship between climate change and economic outcomes, with a special emphasis on the consequences of extreme weather events. Recently, his work has examined the impact of extreme weather on government behavior.

item.title: Zhenhuan Yang
item.description:
PhD student

Zhenhuan Yang is a second-year PhD student at The Hong Kong University of Science and Technology (Guangzhou), where he specializes in the Innovation, Policy, and Entrepreneurship Thrust (IPE) and the Carbon Neutrality and Climate Change Thrust (CNCC). He holds a Master’s degree in Statistics from Hunan University and a Bachelor’s degree in Applied Statistics from Anhui Agricultural University. Prior to joining the COOL team, Zhenhuan served as a research assistant at the School of Management, University of Science and Technology of China (USTC). His research primarily focuses on the causal relationship between climate change and economic outcomes, with a special emphasis on the consequences of extreme weather events. Recently, his work has examined the impact of extreme weather on government behavior.
